intro: Guatteria kuhlmannii, commonly known as the Kuhlmann's guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are typically berries that contain several seeds, and it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
